agency_name: CENTER FOR WOMEN AND FAMILIES OF SOUTHERN INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers services to survivors of intimate partner abuse or sexual violence.
site_name: CENTER FOR WOMEN AND FAMILIES OF SOUTHERN INDIANA
service_description: Provides services for women and men (regardless of sexual or gender orientation), with or without children, affected by intimate partner domestic violence and/or sexual assault. Services include a 24-hour crisis line, case management, access to emergency shelter, walk-in crisis counseling, hospital advocacy, and help obtaining protective orders and other legal advocacy.
site_details: Call the crisis line or walk in to begin an assessment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 10am-5pm -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Male or female (regardless of sexual or gender orientation), with or without children -- affected by intimate partner domestic violence and/or sexual assault.

service_name: SEXUAL ASSAULT TREATMENT AND ADVOCACY SERVICES
service_description: Sexual Assault Treatment includes a free medical/forensic exam that includes a physical exam, genital exam, and collection of swabs and samples to preserve evidence of a sexual assault. Trained Sexual Assault Nurse Examiners or physicians perform the exams and can provide immediate medical care by treating injuries and offering information about sexually transmitted infections and pregnancy. -- Advocacy Services include support during medical/forensic exam and follow-up, supportive counseling, therapy, resources, information, and case management.
site_details: Call crisis line
site_eligibility: Male or female (regardless of sexual or gender orientation) -- Victims of intimate partner domestic violence and/or sexual assault

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Clark County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information  regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. site_eligibility: Living in Clark County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.

site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring Clark County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses, or children of a veteran

agency_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency providing services for individuals with developmental disabilities.
site_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - DISTRICT 8
service_name: HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED MEDICAID WAIVERS / CAREGIVER SUPPORT SERVICES - DISTRICT 8
service_description: Provides funding for home and residential care services to enable persons with developmental disabilities to live as independently as possible. Client services include developmental evaluation; case management; and referrals to supported living, sheltered employment, and home-care providers. There is a wait list for Medicaid Waivers; however, caregiver support services funds may be available in the meantime.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: With a developmental disability, including intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, autism, down syndrome, or a condition that results in a similar impairment -- Onset for the condition was prior to age 22 -- The disability creates substantial functional limitations (determined by assessment)

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE - CLARKSVILLE DISTRICT
service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). Assistance is provided by phone, email, or on a walk-in basis. Automated information is available 24 hours per day by phone.
site_details: Walk in, call, or send questions by email. -- For phone assistance, follow the phone prompts to hear recorded information by topic or to speak with a live representative. State or federal tax ID number may be required.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The Indiana Department of Health supports Indiana's economic prosperity and quality of life by promoting, protecting, and providing for the health of Hoosiers in their communities.
site_name: BREAST AND CERVICAL CANCER PROGRAM (BCCP) - SOUTHERN REGION
service_description: Provides access to free or low-cost breast and cervical cancer screenings, diagnostic testing, and treatment for women who are uninsured or underinsured. Services provided may include colposcopies, liquid-based cytology tests, high risk panel HPV testing, office visits, pelvic exams/tests, clinical breast exams (CBEs), screening and/or diagnostic mammograms, diagnostic breast ultrasounds, breast biopsies, and consultations. Regional coordinators conduct eligibility assessments and provide referrals to local care providers as well as Medicaid (MA-12) Option 3 Treatment Program enrollment assistance (for those who receive a cancer diagnosis).
site_details: Visit website for additional information and income guidelines. -- Call to request an eligibility assessment.
site_eligibility:
For BCCP: Female resident of Indiana -- With household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Uninsured or underinsured (such as having a high or unmet deductible)

For Services: Age 30-49 for office visit, clinical breast exam, and Pap test -- Age 50-64 for office visit, clinical breast exam, Pap test, and mammogram -- Age 65 or older and not enrolled in Medicare Part B for office visit, clinical breast exam, Pap test, and mammogram

For MA-12 Option 3 Treatment Program: Female residents of Indiana -- Age 18-64 -- Diagnosed with breast or cervical cancer -- Entering or actively receiving treatment -- Not enrolled in Medicare -- Uninsured or with insurance not covering cancer treatment -- With household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office patrols the Indiana East-West Toll Road that runs across northern Indiana.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Clark, Floyd, Harrison, Scott, and Washington County.

agency_desc: An agency that offers services to children and families including prevention services through the Community Partners for Child Safety program.
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY - REGION 18
service_description: Provides home-based case management services to help at-risk families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- Contact will be made by a case manager within 48 hours.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS) or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open Juvenile Probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_name: SPECIALIZED ALTERNATIVES FOR FAMILIES AND YOUTH
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services for foster parenting, adoption and family preservation and reunification.
site_name: SPECIALIZED ALTERNATIVES FOR FAMILIES AND YOUTH (SAFY) - CLARKSVILLE
service_description:
Supports relatives or close friends
caring for youth who are unable to be with their family of origin because of substance use and/or relatives or close friends caring for a youth experiencing substance abuse.
taxonomy_name: Adoption and Foster/Kinship Care Support Groups
nameLevel5: Adoption and Foster/Kinship Care Support Groups
site_details: Call or email for information.
site_eligibility: Live in Clark, Dearborn, Decatur, Floyd, Harrison, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, Scott, Switzerland, or Washington County -- Relatives or close friend caring for youth who are unable to be with their family of origin because of substance use and/or relatives or close friends caring for a youth experiencing substance abuse

agency_name: SPECIALIZED ALTERNATIVES FOR FAMILIES AND YOUTH
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services for foster parenting, adoption and family preservation and reunification.
site_name: SPECIALIZED ALTERNATIVES FOR FAMILIES AND YOUTH (SAFY) - CLARKSVILLE
service_description: Recruits and trains eligible persons to become foster parents. Provides placement and support services for foster parents.
site_details: Call to request an information packet or visit website for more information.
site_eligibility: Live in Clark, Dearborn, Decatur, Floyd, Harrison, Jefferson, Ohio, Ripley, Scott, Switzerland, or Washington County - Age 21 or older -- Able to pass extensive background checks, participate in all required training, and provide a safe home environment

agency_desc: A commercial network of Methadone, Suboxone, Buprenorphine, and Vivitrol clinics providing medication assisted therapy and counseling services for patients recovering from addiction.
service_description: Provides outpatient services to individuals who are addicted to opioid drugs (including opium, morphine, codeine products, heroin, oxycodone, and hydrocodone). Services include medication, counseling, education, and referrals to other agencies as needed.
taxonomy_name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call to schedule intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- In state of withdrawal at intake (not used opiates in the last 24-48 hours) - Note: This does NOT apply to pregnant women. -- Addicted to or dependent on opiates for a minimum of one year -- Without an active prescription for opiate medications -- Willing to submit to physical exam, drug testing, and urine specimen collection

agency_desc: A congressional body of the United States, made up of representatives from each state proportional to population.
service_name: UNITED STATES REPRESENTATIVE - INDIANA'S 9TH DISTRICT - ERIN HOUCHIN - REPUBLICAN
service_description: Represents the 9th Congressional District of south central Indiana in the US House of Representatives. Constituents may contact their representatives with questions or concerns about current or pending legislation. Representative's office may be able to help citizens in navigating the complex federal agency system, such as the Social Security Administration, the Department of Veterans Affairs, the Internal Revenue Service, or any other federal agency.
site_details: Call, write, fax, or email questions, comments, concerns, or other feedback. Submit email through the website.
site_schedule: Indiana Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5:30pm -- Washington DC Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm
site_eligibility: Correspondence is only accepted from persons living in Indiana's Ninth District

agency_desc: A government organization that administers housing assistance programs.

site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-11:30am and 12:30pm-4pm; Fri 8am-noon; by appointment only on Fri
site_eligibility: Low income -- Priority given to age 62 or older or with a disability -- US citizens and eligible immigrants

agency_desc: A government organization that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation).
site_details: There may be a wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers. Please call or visit, www.charlestownhousing.org, for the most current information.
site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-11:30am and 12:30pm-4pm; Fri 8am-noon; by appointment only on Fri
site_eligibility: Household income below set limits based on household size -- Preference given to seniors and those with disabilities

site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter. Food delivery is not provided by trustee's office.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members -- Trustee's office does not provide food delivery.

agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based organization that provides adoption and foster care services, counseling and psychiatric services in southern Indiana and metro Louisville.
service_description: Provides foster care services for children who are unable to remain with their biological families. Services include, case management, individual, family, and group therapy as well as coordination of services. Children are placed in licensed foster homes throughout the community.
site_details: Call for information; children are usually referred by the Indiana Department of Child Services.
site_eligibility: Age 25 or older -- Married (at least one year) or single individuals -- Prefer nonsmokers -- Able to pass criminal background checks for anyone age 18 or older living in the home -- Have stable income

agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based organization that provides adoption and foster care services, counseling and psychiatric services in southern Indiana and metro Louisville.
service_description: Offers therapy services and medication management services to children, adolescents, adults, couples, and families, for ADHD, anxiety, depression, or any number of other diagnoses; with particular focus on changes in mood, defiance, divorce, drug and alcohol, traumatic experiences and trouble in school. Services begin with an intake assessment.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-6pm; Fri 8am-4pm -- Appointments: Mon-Thurs 9am-6pm; Fri 9am-3pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial, psychiatric hospital and outpatient center for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors that provides treatment for people with psychiatric disorders or chemical dependency.
service_description: Offers 24-hour nursing care in a secure setting with an intensive, structured treatment program for persons struggling with severe mental health situations. Provides a short-term treatment designed to help the person and their family move through the crisis and develop a plan to follow afterward. The length of stay depends on each persons situation, ranging from a few days to a week.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 4 or older -- Experiencing severe mental health issues

agency_desc: A commercial, psychiatric hospital and outpatient center for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors that provides treatment for people with psychiatric disorders or chemical dependency.
service_description: Provides treatment for adults, adolescents, and children struggling with severe mental health situations or severe and persistent addiction issues. Utilizes the secure, structured environment of traditional inpatient treatment, while allowing patients to attend to daily responsibilities outside of treatment.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or for an assessment.
site_eligibility: Persons with mental health situations or severe and persistent addiction issues

service_description: Provides comprehensive outpatient substance use disorder treatment to adults with focuses on alcohol, cocaine, marijuana, opiates, and prescription drugs.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Having alcohol or chemical dependency issues

agency_desc: A commercial, psychiatric hospital and outpatient center for children, adolescents, adults, and seniors that provides treatment for people with psychiatric disorders or chemical dependency.
service_description: Provides a structured medical and 12-Step model of treatment for detoxification to persons experiencing, or at risk of  experiencing withdrawal symptoms from extended alcohol or drug use. Offers Suboxone treatment to patients coping with opioid or pain relief medication dependency.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for an assessment.

agency_desc: Responsible for filing vital records or important documents related to Clark County's population and events including marriage licenses, child support, judgements, and official court documents.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. -- Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Responsible for filing vital records or important documents related to Clark County's population and events including marriage licenses, child support, judgements, and official court documents.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Hotline.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm (Closed lunch noon-1pm) -- Indiana Kids Hotline (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Responsible for filing vital records or important documents related to Clark County's population and events including marriage licenses, child support, judgements, and official court documents.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides safety education programs for adults and children in Clark and Floyd counties.
service_description: Provides life-saving services to enhance success in locating persons who are at risk of wandering, such as those with dementia, Alzheimer's, Autism, Down's Syndrome and specific brain injuries. The program involves a specially trained search and rescue team of police, firefighters and paramedics in Clark County. Clients wear a wrist band with an electronic transmitter used by the rescue team to locate an individual reported by caregivers as missing.
site_details: Call for information
site_eligibility: Must have diagnosis of Alzheimer's Disease, Autism, Down Syndrome, brain injury or other special need of risk for wandering.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_name: SILVER CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - CLARK COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Clark County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Clark County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Clark County

service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Clark County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, walk in to pick up an application or call the prosecutor's office for information. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Clark County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.

service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. -- For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local police or county dispatch.
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority, including performing the following duties: controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for the authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Varies by service
